newsitem.title: HONG KONG: S&P rates IDBI's $150 mln FRN BB plus.
newsitem.headline: S&P rates IDBI's $150 mln FRN BB plus.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Friday it had assigned BB+ rating to Industrial Development Bank of India's proposed US$150 million floating-rate notes due in 2004.
S&P also said the rating outlook for the bank, one of India's leading financial institutions, is positive
It said in a statement the rating reflected the sovereign credit risk of the Republic of India.

The rating agency said it was a reflection of the bank's strong market position as one of India's leading financial institutions, its broadly diversified customer base, consistent profitability and sound capitalisation at 16.2 percent on a risk-adjusted basis.
The growing economy and continuing infrastructure development should underpin IDBI's performance over the medium term, although there are weaker sectors to which IDBI has some exposure, S&P said.

But the rating agency said the liberalisation of Indian's economy may increase economic violatility, which combined with increased competition, the deregulation of interest rates and the necessity of funding its activities without the benefit of government support could prove challenging for management.
The positive outlook of the bank was in line with that of Repulic of India, it said.
